column4: hi all - running ubuntu on a new thinkpad and it seems pretty clear that gnome is running in its basic video mode - how would i go about figuring out what driver to install to get the nice video (or if there is one available)? thanks and sorry for the noob question...
Intel, Nvidia, or ATI?
I believe it's intel - it's the onboard video
Try going Preferences -> Appearance
then go to the "Visual Effects" Tab
ah HA!
You could also go to add/remove.. and get the advanced compiz settings manager. :)
hmm, it searched for drivers and then said effects cannot be enabled. does that mean I'm SOL?
Hm. Do you know the card's name, or the amount of memory it has?
negative, although I should be able to figure that out, right? lshow?
thank you, I will check that out
I'm not sure. :) Never had that problem, I built my computer myself so. :-P Do you know what the computer model is? Or your Mobo name?
it's a Thinkpad SL300 - I think the graphics card is pretty bottom-of-the-barrel
try what raylu said. :)
Try going System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers.
nothing in the list...
just doing some looking about, holy on. ^^
raylu: here's the relevant output of lspci -v: http://pastie.org/339968
Sorry I'm not that great at all this, sort of new to all this myself, but trying my best :)
raylu: thanks much for your help!
Sorry I couldn't be of much help!
it's the effort that counts - I appreciate it : )
